page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: OVER HALF THE QUADRANT IS SALT MARSH AND ESTUARY. THE SOUTH WEST (LOWER LEFT) CORNER OF THE QUADRANT IS LIMESTONE AT 60 METRES SLOPING SHARPLY DOWN TO THE MARSH. IT IS ON THIS SLOPE THAT THE VILLAGE OF LLANRHIDIAN AND ITS CHURCH IS FOUND. THE SOUTH EAST OF THE QUADRANT IS MILLSTONE GRIT AND THERE ARE LARGE TRACTS OF MOORLAND SUCH AS WELSH MOOR AND THE HIGH GROUND OF CIL IFOR TOP. TOWARDS THE NORTH EAST IS THE EDGE OF THE LOWER COAL SERIES AND HERE IS FOUND THE SMALL HAMLET OF WERNFFRWD.
